has been hailed as the fastest base model, the most beautiful ever made, and the first mid-engined ‘Vette. Unfortunately, it is also the hardest modern ‘Vette to get your hands on. For the 2020 model year, Chevrolet produced only half of what was planned and many of the cars were immediately snatched up by dealers and collectors who turned around and sold them for a huge profit. While everyone was hoping for 2021 to be a little better, it is actually not trending that way and as of the end of January, less than 5,000

have been produced. These production delays that have carried over from 2020 have deprived even some of the biggest dealer’s lots of the new Corvette making it harder and harder to buy but who needs to buy one when you can win one?
The International Motor Racing Research Center (IMRRC) is giving away this awesome

example in a raffle. It is a well optioned example complete with a Jet Black Napa leather upholstery, 2LT trim package, and the Z51 performance package. A set of Carbon Flash full length dual racing stripes and wheels add the perfect amount of contrast to the flashy exterior finish and the 495-horsepower 6.2-liter V8 engine and 8-speed dual clutch transmission offer the performance to back up the cars new supercar style.

The best part is that all you have to do to be entered to win is make a charitable donation of as little as $25 to IMRRC. For your minimal donation you will get 12 entries in the drawing. If you want to increase your odds, you can donate more. For example, a $250 donation is worth 180 tickets and for $2,500 you will get 2,800 tickets. As a Motorious reader though, you get 25-percent more tickets regardless of how much you donate. All donations benefit the cause of preserving and sharing the history of motorsports for future generations. This is a great cause and a great prize, so don’t miss out.
